str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Zebedee, father of the apostles James and John. Of Hebrew origin; Zebedaeus, an Israelite.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A hired servant, hireling. From misthoo; a wage-worker.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
